4.8.4.4	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for the management of urinary fistula

Use magnetic resonance imaging for diagnosis and characterisation of urethral diverticula, 
with urethroscopy, voiding cystourethrogram and ultrasound where necessary.
Offer surgical removal of symptomatic urethral diverticulum.

If conservative treatment is adopted, warn patients of the small (1â€“6%) risk of cancer 
developing within the diverticulum.
